result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Kelly O. Puntillo was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:20 am - 11:45 am Defendant Kelly O. Puntillo in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases heard: 14CF323, 15CF163 & 14TR4993R.  Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 in 14CF323 & no contest in count 1 & count 3 in 15CF163.  Court adjudged guilty of these counts and enters JOC.  Court imposes in 14CF323: count 1 of the information: 4 1/2 years prison with 18 months initial  & 3 years extended supervision, $3214.00, 36 month revocation & IID, $39.00 blood draw, AODA & treatment, DNA sample and $250.00 surcharge.  Count 2 dismissed. Defendant eligible for Substance Abuse program, not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.  Sentence to commence forthwith.

 In 15CF163 Count 1 of the information: 90 days jail with huber concurrent to 14CF323, $243.00 costs, Count 2: s/w/h 2 years probation consecutive to prison term in count 1 in 14CF323, costs of $518.00, AODA & treatment, DNA sample, no contact with EJP, not to be at the Columbus hospital unless life threatening.   Dismiss count 3 & 4 and 14TR4993R.   Jail credit to  be determined.

Defendant Kelly O. Puntillo by video, in custody with attorney Brian Severson.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $500.00 cash bond.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
